newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican unemployment rate 4.8 pct in Nov - Zedillo.
newsitem.headline: Mexican unemployment rate 4.8 pct in Nov - Zedillo.

text.p: President Ernesto Zedillo said on Tuesday the open unemployment rate in Mexico was 4.8 percent in November, the lowest level in 22 months.

"In November, the open unemployment rate in the country was 4.8 percent which is the lowest level in the last 22 months," Zedillo said during a ceremony to hand out the National Quality Prize. The official statistics were due out later Tuesday.
The 4.8 percent rate announced by Zedillo was better than the 5.1 percent MXAAP expected in a Reuters survey. The rate was 5.2 percent in October.

According to the International Labor Organization, the open unemployment rate is calculated as a percentage of the economically active population measuring people 12 years of age or older who during the reference period failed to work at least one hour a week.

Besides the falling unemployment rate, Zedillo highlighted a sharp rise in October industrial output reported on Monday, that he said showed particularly vibrant manufacturing and construction sectors.
Mexico is recovering from a 1995 recession that was the worst one-year performance of the economy in 50 years.
